description: Proposed Roof Alterations with the construction of a rear dormer window and insertion of roof windows
decision_conditions: The proposed alterations would result in an uncharacteristic crown roof feature  which would add significant visual bulk and would introduce an incongruous design feature within the Conservation Area, detrimental to the character of the subject dwelling and wider heritage setting. Further to this the provision of roof-lights to the side facing roof slope of the main dwelling would detract from the architectural quality of the dwelling. As such the development cumulatively would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area and is therefore, contrary to Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and consequently Policies 26 and 28 of the Havering Local Plan 2016-2031. With regards to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), the level of harm to the Conservation Area is considered less than substantial, which enacts Paragraph 202.
